snippet: Gov. Chris Christie has opposed the entry of any Syrian refugees into New Jersey, but he has no control over the federal resettlement program.
abstract: Family of seven Syrian refugees is settled in house near Paterson, NJ, despite Gov Chris Christie's vow not to participate in resettlement program until Federal Bureau of Investigation can guarantee refugees are not terrorists; Christie has no authority over federal program, and his threat to withhold state financial support may violate New Jersey's stringent anti-discrimination laws.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Chris Christie has opposed the entry of any Syrian refugees into New Jersey, but he has no control over the federal resettlement program.

headline.main: Syrian Family of 7 Is Settled in New Jersey Against Christie’s Opposition
headline.print_headline: Syrian Family of 7 Is Settled in New Jersey Against Christie’s Opposition
